notes.text:
Updated cfme packages that fix bugs and add various enhancements
are now available for Red Hat CloudForms 4.2.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat CloudForms Management Engine delivers the insight, control, and automation needed to address the challenges of managing virtual environments. CloudForms Management Engine is built on Ruby on Rails, a model-view controller (MVC) framework for web application development. Action Pack implements the controller and the view components.

This update fixes various bugs and adds several enhancements. Documentation for these changes is available in the Release Notes linked to in the References section.

Security Fix(es):

* A logic error in valid_role() in CloudForms role validation could allow a
tenant administrator to create groups with a higher privilege level than
the tenant administrator should have. This would allow an attacker with
tenant administration access to elevate privileges. (CVE-2017-2632)

This issue was discovered by Matouš Mojžíš (Red Hat).

All CFME users are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which correct these issues and add these enhancements.
notes.title: Details

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

notes.text: Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in exceptions.rb in the i18n gem before 0.6.6 for Ruby allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via a crafted I18n::MissingTranslationData.new call.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: rubygem-i18n: cross-site scripting flaw in exception handling
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

For details on how to apply this update, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258
